p: Regarding the antifungal activity of the isolated compounds, α-pinene was, by far, the most effective compound ( Table 2). Indeed, α-pinene showed a fungicidal effect for most of the tested strains, being very effective against C. neoformans and T. rubrum (MIC = 0.07 mg/mL). Contrarily, 1,8-cineole and camphene were ineffective against many of the tested strains, while borneol showed a slight antifungal effect (MIC ranging from 1.11 to 4.5 mg/mL; Table 2).
